reviews.text: Change of flight plans made it necessary for us to find nearby lodging. Radisson Hotel Narita was not our first choice, but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise for these values: Convenience; Comfort; Cleanliness; Friendly & Courteous Service; Outstanding East-West Food & Beverage; Touch of Local Culture; Peaceful and Spacious Grounds & Surroundings; Choice of Recreation; Shopping & Tour Options; far more than expected, and we will return to the Radisson Hotel at Narita.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: After paying atrocious prices for matchbox size rooms in the rest of Japan, this is a great place to spend the last night of your stay. The rooms are big and inexpensive, the property is expansive and is located in a quaint rural settling. Great place for a morning jog among the underrated Japanese countryside. With a wide breakfast spread, it's a great place to sleep, eat and catch your flight back.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a stopover, needs more frequent shuttle service

likes.liked: — Large rooms, free breakfast and internet access

reviews.text: The major con is that the location is quite isolated, so there's really nothing to do close by. You are hence reliant on the hotel shuttle bus to go anywhere (Narita station or the Airport), considering how expensive Japanese taxis are. Unfortunately, the shuttle bus has poor (and varying) frequencies, less than 1 per hour most times. We had to take the taxi from Narita station as we'd missed the bus by 10 mins and the next bus was 80 mins. later!
reviews.title: Great for kids

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night after arriving from the states on a 5 pm flight. We figured we'd be too tired to move on that evening and we were right. The Radisson met our needs - provided us with an affordable, convenient, clean and quiet place to stay upon arrival before heading to Kyoto the next day.
reviews.title: excellent value - met our needs
